== Detect Hardware - System Profiler ==

=== How to generate and store a Pastebin weblink - for easy access to your computer's profile. ===

Developers need to know the precise details of the hardware you use to analyse test results, look at bug reports, or discuss technical issues.  When you add your 'quick link' here, it speeds up the process for everyone. 

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Pastebin | Pastebin]]</nowiki> works great for short term storage of snippets of code; however, when you need to store your system information for greater lengths of time, this is the way to do it.

The <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Pastebin | Pastebin]]</nowiki> weblink does NOT report personal data from your computer.

''' This means that your passwords, privacy, and other sensitive information remain safe.''' 

== PROCEDURE ==

=== Install these three applications (from trusted standard Ubuntu repositories): ===

* '''hardinfo''' - Gets the information.
* '''pastebinit''' - Sends the information to pastebin.
* '''clipit''' - Reports back the link.

Simply copy/paste the command below into your <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal | terminal]]</nowiki>:

<pre>
sudo apt-get install hardinfo pastebinit clipit
</pre>

Press ENTER and the command will run.

You will be asked for your password. After that, just answer '''Y''' to all the questions. 

Note: Once these applications are installed, you do not need to install them again. When you need to create another link, skip this step, and go on to the next step.

=== Run this command to get your pastebin link: ===

Next, in your <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UsingTheTerminal | terminal]]</nowiki>, copy/paste the command below. 
<pre>
hardinfo -ram devices.so|sed '/\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/,/\*\*\*\*\*\*\*/d'|pastebinit -b http://pastebin.com|clipit -c
</pre>

Press ENTER and the command will run. 

Ignore the error comments that it throws up. You will see your <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Pastebin | Pastebin]]</nowiki>  weblink upon completion. 

The link will look similar to this, altered for your personal information: '''http://pastebin.com/aDU4RVzY'''

=== Add your link to the ENTRY TABLE ===

Copy your Pastebin weblink into the ENTRY TABLE below, under the column heading SPECIFICATIONS. Please fill in the other details as indicated. Do not use the other table; that is for staff use only.

(If you are not familiar with editing wiki pages, please get in touch with us. Someone will be happy to help you.)  

Make sure to bookmark this page for speedy access to your link.
